name: ChargeDistribution
comment: Maintains details of the charges and event offer distributions across account Pay Channels, for the same customer or different customers. These details enable mapping of a subscriber s one-time charges, subscriber/agreement service recurring charges, and usage events, such as calls and short text messages (SMS) to the subscriber account pay channels or any other payer account.
vf short description: Maintains details of the charges and event offer distributions across account Pay Channels, for the same customer or different customers.

fields.name: ChargeDistributionSK
fields.comment: Surrogate key of the object

fields.name: ValidFromDate
fields.comment: BI field which represents record validity begin in EDWH

fields.name: ValidUntilDate
fields.comment: BI field which represents record validity end in EDWH

fields.name: KeyTypeId
fields.comment: Key type of record

fields.name: ChargeDistributionKey
fields.comment: Unique identifier of the charge distribution in ALDM. Each charge distribution key value represents a unique charge distribution.

fields.name: ChargeDistributionId
fields.comment: Unique identifier of the charge distribution in the source system.

fields.name: PayChannelSK
fields.comment: Surrogate key of the object

fields.name: SubscriberSK
fields.comment: Surrogate key of the object

fields.name: AgreementSK
fields.comment: Surrogate key of the object

fields.name: FinancialAccountSK
fields.comment: Surrogate key of the object

fields.name: BillingArrangementSK
fields.comment: Surrogate key of the object

fields.name: CustomerSK
fields.comment: Surrogate key of the object

fields.name: ChargeSplitCode
fields.comment: Indicates the type of split for charge distribution. The values are:Default OC (DO) - All subscriber one-time charges Default RC (DR) - All subscriber recurring charges RC for SOC (RS) - All subscriber recurring charges for a specific serviceFor event distribute, it indicates the distribution type from which valid split attributes are derived. The values are:Default (for subscriber) - Only the target account and billing arrangement are defined for this distribution type. Event Group - The event group identifiers (feature and parameter) must be defined for this distribution type.

fields.name: EffectiveDate
fields.comment: Indicates the date on which charge distribution becomes effective.

fields.name: ExpirationDate
fields.comment: Indicates the date on which the charge distribution expires.

fields.name: DistributionLevelInd
fields.comment: Indicates the distribution level. Values are: - S=Subscriber level distribution - A=Agreement level distribution

fields.name: ChargeDistributionTypeInd
fields.comment: Indicates the charge distribution type.Values are:C - ChargeE - Event

fields.name: EffectiveIssueDate
fields.comment: Indicates the logical date on which the effective date, EFFECTIVE_DATE, for a charge distribution was set or updated. For backdated transactions, this is the logical date on which the transaction was actually issued or performed.

fields.name: EventGroupDistributionTypeInd
fields.comment: Indicates the distribution type, from which the valid split attributes are derived. Values are:- D=Default (for subscriber) - Only the target account and billing arrangement are defined for this distribution type. - E = Event Group - The event group identifiers (feature and parameter) are defined for this distribution type.

fields.name: EventGroupItemCode
fields.comment: Indicates the item code of the offer to which a distribution belongs.

fields.name: AssignedBillingOfferSK
fields.comment: Surrogate key of the object

fields.name: ProductCatalogSK
fields.comment: Surrogate key of the object

fields.name: BssCreationDate
fields.comment: Indicates the date on which a record was created in the source system

fields.name: BssModificationDate
fields.comment: Indicates the date on which a record was modified in the source system

fields.name: ModificationEmployeeSK
fields.comment: Surrogate key of the object

fields.name: ExpirationIssueDate
fields.comment: Indicates the logical date on which the effective date, EFFECTIVE_DATE, for a charge distribution was set or updated. For backdated transactions, this is the logical date on which the transaction was actually issued or performed.

fields.name: OfferInstanceId
fields.comment: Identifies the billing offer instance associated with the charge distribution.

fields.name: BillingOfferId
fields.comment: Indicates the billing offer associated with the charge distribution.

fields.name: SourceSystemId
fields.comment: Represents the code of the source system that the leading entity of the current target is coming from. It is suffix also include the code of the DB instance on that system such that in case of multiple instances of the same source system are deployed (Scalability) it will be possible to trace the target to it is source system instance

fields.name: DeleteIndicator
fields.comment: Set to True when the leading source entity of this target entity was deleted in the source system

fields.name: RowUpdateTime
fields.comment: The time stamp when the row was written to the Target real-time/staging storage

fields.name: SourceUpdateTime
fields.comment: The latest create/update timestamp of any of the entities composing this target entity

fields.name: SourceQueryTime
fields.comment: The timestamp of reading the data from source system. - when using CDC it is usually similar to the latest update, in SQL cases it is the time of running the SQL. When a dummy target entity is created as a temporary entity to maintain referential integrity this indicator will be set to True. As soon as the real target entity is stored it will be stored with False dummy indicator value.

fields.name: DptiId
fields.comment: Counter which represents the cycle number of the job	is_deleted	boolean	is_deleted	Represents if the record is deleted. Is been updated after the compaction job

fields.name: PTime
fields.comment: Partition time based on the event time for target entities marked to be partitioned event time rounded the correct partition window (hourly, daily etc..)

fields.name: Insert_Load_Id
fields.comment: BI technical field for job id which inserted the record in the table

fields.name: Update_Load_Id
fields.comment: BI technical field for job id which updated the record in the table
